column1: outside off stump and left alone by Masakadza.
shapes back in, and takes the batsman by surprise. He defends well, though.
pitched up again, and this time he goes a little out of shape in driving. No fielder when it goes aerial, no run
swings back in, a polite appeal. Good start here by the bowler, though it was going well down leg
pitched up, and this time Masakadza gets it through the vacant mid-wicket region. Gets himself and his team off the mark with two
down the leg side, and takes the pad along the way. Goes all the way for four, spoiling what was otherwise a pretty good first over
length ball on the pads. No runs as he played it straight to short mid-wicket
straight ball which forces Zhuwao to play it away defensively.
GONE. Straight ball again, and he swings across the line without any footwork. Just clips the top of off-stump, and then there's Saifuddin's celebration where he thumps his chest.
straight up to him. Comes forward and defends.
defended off a length
strays on to the pads, but Taylor's shot is straight to the fielder stationed alongside the square-leg umpire
comes forward and defends. Mushfiqur Rahim approves of the length
raps him on the pad. They are contemplating a review. Good movement back into pads. Big wicket this, but Hider can't convince the senior players into going for it
played to covers, straight to the fielder stationed there

chops this one onto the stumps. Bangladesh on fire at the moment. Almost had him LBW just a couple of balls ago, and now gets Masakadza to mistime an attempted drive completely. Bangladesh couldn't have asked for a better start.
lovely shape away from the left-hander, though Williams too did see it straight through to the gloves of Mushfiq
almost had a dab at another away-swinger. Through to the keeper
played back to the bowler. Zimbabwe haven't had a run off the bat since the first over
this one keeps a bit low. Taylor has to bend to keep it out. Is there a bit of variable bounce that Zimbabwe could work with?
driven straight to the cover fielder. They need some patience here, and have two quality batsmen to build a partnership with
left this alone and it wasn't too far from his off stump
played away to the on-side, but not a possibility of a single
played away to the off-side. What a great over here from Saifuddin. Right on the money!
still keeps it outside off, and Williams is not interested in offering a shot yet
first ball that Williams gets on his bat. Solid defence, as you would expect at 6 for 2
a bit of movement away, and Williams gets the inside of the bat on to his pad. Close!
left alone again, as the ball swings away from outside off
way outside off stump and Williams squeezes it away. Point saves it from going outside the inner ring, but cannot prevent the first run in 23 balls
played away to the on side, but for no runs. Another tidy over that keeps Zimbabwe in check
strays down the leg side, and Zhuwao gets it away for four. Plays it one-handed virtually
decent shape back in to Williams. Plays it away to the on side
outside off, and defended to the cover fielder
terrific push away to the off side. Didn't look to hit it too hard, and placed it nicely between cover and point
that was quick, and cutting across Williams. Did well to jab his bat down on time
driven down the ground, just past Saifuddin's left leg. Exquisite timing there from Williams, who is looking good so far
opens the face of the bat and gets it through the infield. Two runs comfortably for Taylor
defended outside off
defended outside off stump. The bowler has come around the wicket now
lofted over mid-on, and one bounce into the fence. Suggests that this is a good batting track and Zimbabwe should aim to set the foundation for a biggish score
back to over the wicket, and just angling across Taylor, who covers it comfortably with a forward defensive shot
that was played on to the pads and popped up. A game effort from Hider at getting to it, but just cannot latch on.
length ball, a bit of room outside off, goes for the cut but hits it straight to the man at cover-point
fuller on stumps, pushed towards covers
pitched up once again, presents the full face of the bat to work it towards mid-off
length outside off, comes forward and defends
driven this time, comes forward and dispatches it through the covers for four
pitched up once more, lunges forward and defends
a low full toss outside off, Taylor mistimes the drive towards mid-off
bouncer this time, Taylor waits for it to come, sways back at the very last moment to ramp it over the keeper, great improvisation
fuller outside off and driven through covers off the front foot for a couple
slower one this time, pitched up outside off, driven straight to the short cover fielder
length ball, punched off the back foot through cover and extra cover, collects another brace
length ball, outside off, Taylor lets it go through to the keeper
short of length outside off, pushed towards short extra cover
fuller outside off and driven past mid-off for another couple, a bit of tag team work there by the mid-off and mid-on fielders
length ball, around middle and off, Williams defends it with a closed bat
short of length, some room outside off, Williams cuts it to the left of the cover fielder who makes a brilliant diving stop
length ball, just outside off, defended
length ball around off, defended from the crease towards point
starts with a length ball outside off, Taylor is happy to defend it
slightly shorter and wider this time, Taylor slashes it towards third man
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot towards the right of mid-off
short around middle and leg and pulled away, there is a fielder at deep square leg though which means Williams would get only a single
back of length around off stump, Taylor comes forward and defends it on the leg side
length outside off, kept a little low as Taylor went for the punch and missed
starts with a fuller delivery around off, Williams loses the shape there and ends up pushing it towards mid-on
length ball, around off, defended from the crease
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot towards sweeper cover for a couple
length again and punched down the ground this time, beats mid-off for another brace
pulls back his length, defended by Williams
similar sort of line and length, Williams comes forward and blocks
short of length outside off, cuts it off the back foot towards covers for one
short of length around middle and chipped over square leg for yet another two
length ball, slower one on the pads, flicked away towards fine leg
short of length around off, defended from the front foot

fuller on stumps and driven back towards the bowler off the front foot, Ariful fields the ball and throws towards the stumps at the striker's end and ends up hitting Taylor flush on the pads. Bangladesh are appealing for obstructing the field. The two umpires are having a chat and ask the bowler to continue in the end, Taylor was well outside his crease though when the ball hit him, but he never changed his direction
a tad fuller outside off, Taylor comes forward and drives it firmly, but straight to the short cover fielder
length ball, angling across, defended from the crease towards covers
floated outside off stump, driven towards the left of mid-off for a quick single
length ball, around off, Taylor comes forward and looks to defend, the ball hit him near the handle
short of length this time, Taylor was looking to push at it, gets a thick inside edge towards square leg
slower one this time, steered towards point, a fumble there a good recovery allows no extra run
slower one once more, pushed towards covers for a quick single
length ball, punched from the back foot towards mid-off
short of length around off, punched gently towards the left of the point fielder
lovely shot! It was a length ball, around middle, Taylor came forward, presented the full face, extended his arms for one bounce four, dead straight
length ball, around middle and leg, tucked away behind square this time for one
short of length, pulled away towards deep square leg for another single
short and wide and Taylor gives it the treatment it deserved. Slaps it between extra cover and mid-off for the second four off the over
length ball, angling in towards the batsman, dabbed towards square leg
length ball, around middle and leg, glanced towards fine leg
fuller on stumps, Williams plays it from the crease and defends it on the leg side
short of length outside off, Williams looks to punch it but the ball hits the inner half of the bat and goes towards square leg
short of length outside off, punched straight to extra cover
a touch fuller but by no means a half-volley, Williams came forward and drove it on the up, didn't middle it and finds mid-off on the bounce
starts with a short one and Taylor pulls it behind square leg, the fine leg fielder came sprinting to his left but couldn't prevent the four
length ball, around middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on for a quick single
fuller and wider, Williams look to go for a booming drive but fails to connect
a touch shorter this time, Williams connects the drive this time but finds Mashrafe at short extra cover
fuller on middle, pushed uppishly back towards the bowler, a low chance to his right, gets his hand down but it doesn't stick
short of length outside off, Williams runs it down towards third man
short of length outside off from around the wicket, punched towards mid-off
length ball, on the pads, a short-arm flick towards square leg
short of length outside off, driven on the up but straight to the extra cover fielder
short of length outside off, defended back towards the bowler, who has just overstepped here. Free hit coming up
ends up bowling it in the slot, over-pitched around off stump, Taylor clears his front leg and lofts it over wide long for a six
length ball, comes forward and blocks
length ball, just outside off, looked like an offcutter, Taylor comes forward and defends it on the leg side
length ball, but wide outside off, Williams slashes at it, doesn't middle it as the ball goes uppishly towards third man
shot of the day so far! It was fuller around middle and leg, Taylor just nonchalantly flicks it over midwicket and it sails over the fence for six
works it towards square leg for two more
fuller around middle and leg, pushes it towards long-on
length ball, angling across the left-hander, Williams was caught at the crease, ends up pushing at it and gets beaten, almost gets squared up
length ball, around middle and leg, pushed towards mid-on
length outside off, punched off the back foot towards deep extra cover for a couple
length ball, just around off, dabs it on the leg side and looks to steal a single, the short midwicket fielder comes charging in to prevent the run
and that's 50 for Taylor, it was full outside off, he drops it towards point and sprints across. A sublime knock so far, he would like to convert this into a big one
length ball, pitching around leg, Williams looks to go for the pull but misses and gets rapped near the knee roll, a loud appeal but it pitched way outside the leg stump
length ball, on the pads, flicked towards deep square leg
and ends the over with a boundary. It was a touch fuller, just outside off, Taylor came forward and lofted it past the bowler for another four
gets forward to push a fuller one to the left of the bowler
looped up on leg stumps, gets down and unfurls a reverse sweep through the acres of vacant space in the covers
leg-side length ball, tucked off the pads to short fine
similar line and length, tucked in front of square to deep midwicket this time
advances, gets to the pitch and quietly pinches a single down to long-off
gets a bit of an under edge as he sweeps to deep backward square leg
gets forward to a length ball and flicks to midwicket
fuller ball, pushed to the right of the bowler
gets down for a reverse sweep and knocks it behind point
pitches up a fuller one on leg stump, driven to long-on
leg side length ball, flicked to deep midwicket
good length on middle and leg, defended
full on middle and off, blocked off the front foot
spins away from a length and beats the outside edge as he presses forward to reach out
full on middle and leg, pushed into the on side
pitched up and slid into middle, right in the arc as he gets down on one knee and slogs it out of deep midwicket
another slog, with the angle, the connection isn't as great but he manages to send it a couple of bounces over deep midwicket
short, straightening outside off, cut to sweeper cover
full on off, pushed down the ground to long-on
back of a length, comes on straight at leg stump, tries to tuck it away and misses
backs away to cut, it's a leg side line to start with, he misses and the ball has just missed leg stump
drives a fuller one to long-on
slides a fuller one across, driven to long-off. Fifty for Williams
full on middle and leg, defended
reverse-sweeps a fuller one behind point, right between point and backward point
full on middle and leg, defended
advances down the ground and blocks to cover
full on off, driven to long-off
full, slid into leg stump, pushed to the left of mid-on who dives and stops it
full on middle and leg, reverse-swept to short third man
back of a length, punched to long-on
full, slid into leg, clipped to midwicket
back of a length, punched to long-off
full on middle and leg, driven straight back
comes down the track and works it into the on side
advances down the ground and hammers it one-bounce to long-on
full, slid into middle and leg, chipped straight over and a couple of bounces over long-on
gets down for a slog sweep, has to fetch it from way outside off, and ends up skewing it in the air off the top edge from the lower part of the bat, Mushfiqur settles under it
advances down the ground and straight away heaves it over long-on. What an entry!
full on middle, blocked off the front foot
reverse-sweeps a fuller one through point, sweeper cover gets around it
full, slid into leg stump, blocked
back of a length, leg side, tries to tuck and wears it on the pad
back of a length, punched to cover
back of a length on off, tucked to midwicket
jams the bat down as the ball shoots past the outside edge
reverse-sweeps a fuller ball through extra cover
advances down the ground to a full toss and drives through extra cover
comes down the ground and hammers this through point, the man in the deep cuts it off
back of a length, straightens on middle and leg, pulled to deep midwicket
full on off, defended
full, pushed across, driven to long-off
short, slid in, gets down and pulls behind square leg
short of a length, outside off, cut to the left of sweeper cover
shuffles across and goes hard at a cut and misses
floated up outside off, pushed wide of point
full, turned away into on side
full ball at 126ks across off, pushed down the ground to the right of mid-off
short and wide, cut to the left of sweeper cover
oh, beauty! A length ball that angles in subtly and goes on with the arm to just beat the outside edge and miss off-stump
full, clipped to midwicket
short of a length, blocked to cover
tucked to midwicket
advances down the ground and drills it to long-off
full on leg, clipped to mid-on
length ball, shifts back and tries to tuck it away but wears it on the pad
turned away with the spin to square leg
length, slanted across off, drilled straight back
full on middle and leg, turned away past a diving midwicket fielder.. he gets a hand but pushes it away
full, clipped off the pads to deep midwicket
full, angled across off, pushed towards mid-on
full outside off, driven to cover who lets it go through the legs
back of a length, opens the face to point
tries to back away and cut and gets an inside edge past the stumps
length, spins in on middle, pushed to long-off
short and wide, tries to slap it away and extra cover dives to his right and stops it
short, spins in, backs away and cuts to cover
full on middle and leg, driven to extra cover
pitched up on leg, clipped to midwicket
short of length on middle and leg, punched down the ground
full on middle and leg, gets an inside edge to deep fine leg as he drives at it
walks down the ground and slaps this short ball to cover
short of a length on off, angled in, pulled away to deep midwicket
back of a length, opens the face and guides to point
defends a length ball down the ground
short and pulled away, but towards a sweeper. Just a single
driven down the on-side, where midwicket comes across and pulls off a stop. Enough to prevent a run
backed up well by short midwicket again. A drive, but for no runs
the ball cuts into him, and he backs away and pushes it towards cover for a single
right into the blockhole, and Williams can't do anything other than pat it away
driven straight, half-stopped by the bowler, and the ricochet doesn't go far enough to allow any runs
driven towards mid-off, and a bit to the left. Ample time for the batsmen to go through for a single
short and pulled it away beautifully. Just a good bit of timing, and did well to play it in front of square through the vacant mid-wicket region. Just 17 away from a century here

slightly slower off-cutter and Williams plays it to the off-side. There's a shy at the stumps, and the batsmen are able to take an overthrow after the ball just misses the stumps. Would have been a close one had it hit
moves across the stumps and flicks it in the air but into the gap. Finds a man in the deep, but enough time to pick up two. Sensible batting
width on offer, and he hits it well. Goes straight to Soumya Sarkar at mid-off and quickly. No chance for any runs
tapped away to the off with an open face of the bat and soft hands. They have done well to pick up an extra run for the overthrow. Some ragged work from Bangladesh in the field
short and flicked away on the onside. Two runs on offer as the man sweeping has a fair amount of ground to cover
good stop off his own bowling. Williams hit that well. but he was quick to cut it off
tucked away on the on-side for one. Who will be the aggressor here for Zim?
it is Raza on strike, and he hits it crisp, but too close to the fielder on the offside
another straight ball back to the bowler
right up in length, and he scoops it away to retain strike with a single on the off side
Raza dabs it down to third man, and there's some fantastic running to convert it into two. Zimbabwe batting well here
fielded at mid-off. Raza was looking to hit it hard, but got no runs for it. Must also watch for Saifuddin's changes of pace
through covers for a single
taps it away to the offside and picks up a single comfortably
drifted on to leg, and Raza flicks it towards backward square and picks up two quite easily
played straight to midwicket, and there's a fielder right there for it. Dot ball to end
driven far too close to the man inside the ring at short cover
flicks it away towards the midwicket fence. No problems in keeping it down to one
flicked straight to mid wicket
straight to the short midwicket fielder
out to the sweeper at the cover fence for a single
quick single as the bowler goes to short midwicket to fetch this. Williams is into the 90s now
down the leg side and Williams goes for a slog sweep. Doesn't time it too well, and thankfully so. It drops short of the fielder and deep backward square leg
doesn't get any timing on this, looking to heave it away on the off side. The ball barely escapes the square
plays it on to himself again. No run for this
played away to the offside, with a steer to covers, for a single
flicked away on the on side but straight to the fielder. Good over so far
opens the face of the bat and picks up a single with a poke into the off side. Just three runs off that 41st over - perfect for Bangladesh
he pings it away on the onside, where short midwicket makes a half-stop. The misfield allows the batsmen to cross over
short loopy slower ball, and Raza got hold of it, but only ran it down to short fine leg. The batsmen scampered through, and nearly ran Williams out
driven down the ground for a single
full and straight, Raza opens his stance up and just glides it through the vacant point region for four. Excellent shot in how effortless he made it look
short, and pulled away towards midwicket. There is a fielder down there and he will only get a single. Williams on strike, potentially one stroke away from his second ODI ton
plays it off his hips, and the flick gives him two. Hemant to take over with commentary duties now
starts with a high full toss, Raza looks to go big but ends up mistiming it and the long-on fielder takes an easy catch near the fence
length ball, punched back towards the bowler
fuller on stumps, driven towards long-on
length ball, goes for the paddle and sets off, the short fine leg fielder throws at the wrong end, Williams was way short
pushed towards long-off for a walking single
length ball, just outside off, punched towards long-on
length ball, angling across, punched towards the right of extra cover who makes a partial stop
fuller on stumps and driven firmly down the ground, a bit of tumbling stop there by the fielder and the batsmen sneak in the second one after a bit of yes-no
a low full toss and struck hard right back towards the bowler who bends down in his follow through but could only deflect it towards long-on
length ball, just outside off, punched towards extra cover
slower one this time, pushed back but Saifuddin dives across to make a one-handed stop
and that's his hundred! It was short of length around middle, he punched it towards long-on for a single to bring up the landmark
a leg-side full toss and dispatched to the square leg fence for a one-bounce four. That's his highest ODI score as well
fuller outside off, pushed on the off side, Nazmul moves across to field it himself
down the track and hammered back but the bowler gets his leg behind the ball to convert this into a dot ball
reverse sweep this time, a quick single to short third man
full and wide outside off, that needs to be bowled again
fuller but closer to the stumps this time, Moor fails to connect
pitched up around middle, Moor looks to go big but doesn't middle it, only a single as the ball rolls towards long-on
starts with a length ball which Moor duly dispatches over long-on, the fielder thought for a second he had a chance but it sailed over him easily
and again. A slower one this time and Moor cleared his front leg and smashed it over wide long-on
fires in wide outside off, Moor reaches for it and hits it towards extra cover for a single
moves across, but a tad too early, Mashrafe follows him and concedes only a leg-bye to short fine leg
a wide full toss, slapped towards deep extra cover, protection there
smashed! Gives himself room and hits it hard, through extra cover. It was another length ball from Mashrafe, you cannot bowl those at this stage of the innings. A big over that one for Zimbabwe
full and wide and Moor fails to get bat on that
fuller outside off, driven towards mid-off for one
in the slot, almost a nothing ball, fuller around off and Williams lofts it over wide long-on for his first six of the innings
slower one outside off, Williams waits for it before smashing it towards long-off
a full toss, Moor was looking to play it on the leg side, gets an outside edge towards third man, Hider would consider himself lucky there
length ball, around middle, a short-arm pull from Williams towards deep midwicket, one bounce to the fielder
fuller outside off, steered towards deep backward point for one
a slower bouncer, Moor had to delay his pull there but still gets two to deep square leg
in the blockhole, Moor jams his bat at it to dig it out towards long-on
another slower one, Williams moves across and helps it past short fine leg
fuller outside off, smashed towards deep extra cover and Moor had to put in the dive. Perhaps a stronger and better throw was required

another slower bouncer and Williams forehands it towards deep extra cover, was in the air for a long time but lands safely as the batsmen come back for the second. This is turning out to be a really good knock by Williams
full, almost yorker-length outside off, Moor fails to connect there

is that out? It was one again full and Moor drilled it right back at the bowler who stuck his left hand out and the ball cannoned back into the stumps at the non-striker's end. But replays confirm Williams got his bat down just in time
fuller on the pads and clipped away towards deep square leg
goes for the reverse paddle, it was full outside off but Williams failed to connect
fuller again, Williams clears his front leg but doesn't get the timing right on this one, a single to long-on
fuller on stumps once again, Moor can also dig it out towards long-on
full and straight, Moor hits it hard, the ball hits the foot of the bowler and deflects towards long-off

a high full toss but Williams fails to take advantage of it, ends up skying it towards long-on, falls short of the fielder but a direct at the non-striker's end results in a run-out. Moor put in the dive but was well short
a slower one outside off, Williams looks to go big but misses
slower bouncer, pulled towards deep midwicket but no power behind that
fuller outside off, Chigumbura steers it through covers for a single
and a dot to finish with. It was in the blockhole and Williams could dig it out only back towards the bowler

raps the pad straight away! Huge shout for lbw, given, but this seemed like it was heading down leg. Review promptly taken. Full, angling in, tries to flick and the ball misses the inside edge. Nothing on Ultra Edge. Umpire's call.. Clipping outside of leg stump
short of good length, angled across off, punched to mid-off
shortish and a bit of width, slashed through backward point
just back of a length, tight lines, tries to flick and gets an inside edge to the pad
back of a length, outside off, stands tall and punches to covers
back of a length, slanted across off, slaps it to cover who dives to his right and fields it
short, a bit of width, no pace as it comes on really slow and gets past the inside edge of his flashing bat
short of good length outside off, opens the face to deep point
short, wide, cut hard and cut past point flying to his left
defends this down the pitch towards mid-on
short of good length, angled in from outside off, shuffles across and blocks
length ball angling into off, leans forward and blocks
short ball, angled across and giving him enough room to get on top of it and whack it away with a pull to deep midwicket
short of a length, angled across, punched into the covers
good length outside off, drops it into the covers and is refused the single
slashes away from the body and gets an <b>outside edge that drops short of third man</b
rides the bounce of this back of a length delivery and carves it just over cover leaping back with his hands outstretched
belts out an appeal for lbw as he finds the pad. Not given. Jarvis seems to suggest there might have been an inside edge. Was it also too high? Inside edge confirmed by replays
flicks a fuller one off the pads to deep fine leg
short of length, drags a pull from outside off to mid-on
back of a length outside off, opens the face to deep backward point
another appeal for lbw, this one's half-hearted with the ball clearly sliding down leg
full, wide, inviting the batsman, and Sarkar accepts it with a neat stride forward before dispatching it between cover and extra cover
back of a length outside off, mistimes a pull to midwicket
slides a fullish length ball across, driven to extra cover
slower length ball, pushed down the ground towards mid-off for a quick one
back of a length, angled across, loosely swings away from the body and gets beaten
short of good length on middle, stays back and whips it away behind square
back of a length outside off, plays late to point
good length, angled across close to off, Sarkar trusts the angle and shoulders arms
angles a length ball in too sharply and it skips down leg
good length, nips away outside off and takes the edge to third man
full and angled down leg
full on middle, clipped to deep midwicket
slaps it just over extra cover leaping back as he fails to get entirely on top of this short one
full, angled into middle, pushed back
short, no pace, so all the time he needs to pick that and slap it over the in-field at cover
beautiful placement. Short of a length, waits and opens the face pretty late to split point and cover-point with laser-guided precision
just back of a length, angled across, slashes at it and gets an edge down to third man, past first slip diving to his left
back of a length on middle, tucked to midwicket

in the sir again, and again it's past the fielder diving. Gets on his toes to deal with the bounce of this short of a length delivery, and punched just past point diving to his right. Bangladesh rushing through with a barrage of boundaries but not all of them have been convincing
shapes to play into the leg side but misses and gets hit on the pad. Has it pitched outside leg? Was it high? Pitched outside leg, as replays confirm
pushes away from the body again.. another streaky boundary, off the outside edge to third man
full, angled across, driven to the right of mid-off for a very quick single
length ball outside off, opens the face to third man
back of a length outside off, slapped hard through the covers
short of length, punched to the right of point
back of a length on off, tucked to midwicket
full on off, turns it away to the on side off the inside of the bat
short of length, outside off, punched to deep point
length on off, defended
length ball on leg stump, flicked off the pads through backward square
short, angled across, waits and stabs with an open face through backward of point
full outside off, pushed out through point
good length on middle, carefully blocks to cover
short of a length, tucked through midwicket
overpitched outside off, nicely drawing the batsman forward, and Sarkar responds by throwing his weight behind it for a picture-perfect cover drive
advances down the ground and gets a bottom edge on a forced pull as the bowler drags the length back
back of a length on off, drops it through extra cover for a quick one
short ball, barely ducks, and expectedly called a wide
short of a length on off and middle, tucked through square leg
dipping fuller ball outside off, squeezed out to cover
good length outside off, takes a stride across and blocks to mid-on
cut away, but straight to the man at point
pitched up, he waits on it and drives it down to the cover fielder for one
driven on the on side, but straight to short midwicket
width on offer, but Sarkar doesn't connect well with the cut. Underedge that goes down to short third man.
cut hard and the sweeper does well to keep it down to just the single. Neverthless, what a quick start this has been!
punches this through the offside, again to the sweeper, to retain the strike
tucked away on the leg for a single
seemed to be trying a variation with the ball but dragged it short. Drop-kicked towards the square-leg fence, but along the ground
taken on the full and driven, but can't pierce the infield on the off side
good bit of work by short midwicket, as he intercepts an attempted flick
driven down to long on after taking a couple of steps closer to the pitch of the ball
drives it straight past the bowler, and long on has to do the cleaning up
cut away, but the sweeper will cut this off comfortably
comes forward and smothers the spin
drives this down to long off and picks up another single to keep the scoreboard ticking
it was short and he used the depth of the crease to drive it away on the offside. Only a single to the sweeper, though
through the vacant space on the offside to the sweeper for another single in that region. No-risk batting here
another single on the offside down to the cover fielder
played away with a gentle dab on the leg side

tucks it off his pads and brings up his FIFTY. What a run of form this is for Imrul Kayes -- he came into this match averaging close to 80 since his recall, and his now 31 away from an average of a 100
driven to long on for another single.
driven to long on for another single. The runs are coming nice and easy for Bangladesh now
tries to tuck it away on the onside, but can't get a run for it
no run down to short fine leg
defended off the front foot
is that a drop? Raza dropped this a little short, and Kayes went for the cut, and might have had a tickle on it, but Taylor couldn't hold on anyway
played to short midwicket
played to short midwicket
driven to covers for a single
straight back to the bowler. No runs for him here
no run, played towards the man stationed at 45 degrees on the leg side

swung away and he connects well. All the way over the man at backward square leg. Wellington has done well to tuck the left-handers up by coming around the wicket, and that was the right way to break the shackles
filcked away through the leg side for a single down to the sweeper
driven past the man at short cover for a single
flicked away on the on side. 106 runs for this partnership now
drives it coolly down the ground to long on, and it is time for drinks from the look of things
short and punched on the off side. The sweeper comes in again. He's one guy who is earning his salary well today
short and driven away behind square. Smart placement, as Williams had to do a fair amount of running to get to the ball and to his right, hence allowing for two to be taken
defended off the front foot
tries a late cut, and a poor bit of fielding from Tiripano at short third man gives them an easy single
driven, but stopped by short cover
stopped by the bowler in his follow-through as the bastman drove straight
strays down the leg side, and it seemed like it came off the bat, but has been given as wides. They also ran two
driven through the offside, where Jarvis does the cleaning up at the cover boundary
straight to Raza at short midwicket
looks to sweep this, but plays it straight to H Masakadza, who is at short fine leg
driven down to long on and picks up an easy single
played away on the on side, but straight to the fielder
goes on to the back foot and flicks the ball away and picks up an easy single in the process
comes forward and defends this
driven well, but fielded at short cover
dropped down the leg side, and Kayes seemed tempted to have a dab at it. He lets it be, and it is called wide
drives this through the off side with soft hands, wide of the short cover fielder. Easy single
down the leg side again. Sarkar was looking to sweep this one but missed by a fair margin
that nearly snuck through his defence. Took an inside edge, and somehow contrived to miss his leg, and the stumps
opens the face of the bat and takes a single down to Tiripano, who is stationed at short third man. Needed to be quicker to hurry up the non-striker
cut away but straight to backward point
played away defensively on the offside

comes down the wicket and smashes this way out of the ground to bring up FIFTY runs. It was probably a half-tracker anyway from Williams, but he did well to get to the pitch of it and smash it over midwicket
this time he top-edges a sweep, and it falls wide of Masakadza. Lucky there
driven off the back foot, but fielded by short midwicket
moves across to the onside and flicks it away for a single to the sweeper on the midwicket fence
opens the face of the bat and gets it wide of short third man
short and pulled away towards deep square leg for a single
a tad fuller, Imrul comes forward and defends
tossed up this time but down the leg side
short and wide and Imrul cuts it away for a couple of runs, sweeper cover tidies it up
length ball, Imrul goes back and punches it through covers for a walking single
a touch fuller outside off, Soumya was playing back and in the end lets it go
down the track and drills it straight back at his partner, gets a single but Imrul is in some pain here. The physio is out and is tending to him. It hit him on the left forearm
down the track and slaps this length ball past mid-off for a boundary
back of length outside off, dabbed towards third man
length ball, stands tall and punches it past the diving extra cover who gets some hand on it, mid-off eventually cuts it off
short of length, down the leg side, pulled away towards fine leg, Zhuwao makes a tumbling stop there to keep it to just one
another bouncer, around middle and leg, Imrul ducks under it comfortably
length ball, down the leg side and this one needs to be bowled again
length ball, just outside off, punched towards covers
length ball, just outside off, flat-bats it back, the ball hits the stumps at the other end

it's a no-ball and Soumya has dispatched it over midwicket for a one-bounce four. However, replays show the umpire got it wrong, the bowler had some part of his foot behind the line. Unlucky there, but a free-hit coming up
full and wide, Soumya looks to go big but fails to connect
down the track and cuts it over covers, the fielder is there in the deep
a touch fuller and punched through covers, the sweeper cover makes a sliding stop to his left
length ball, punched off the back foot but extra cover cuts it off
slower one, around middle and off, tucked away towards square leg
length ball, on the pads, glanced towards short fine leg
length again, on the pads, played gently towards square leg
length ball, around off, Imrul turns it away towards deep square leg
length ball, skips down the track and lofts it over deep midwicket for a 71-meter six
length ball, a half-pull, half-sweep towards deep square leg
fuller outside off, driven past the diving cover fielder
length ball, just outside off, defended towards cover-point
short of length around off, tucked away towards square leg for a single
length ball, around middle and leg, dabbed behind the square leg
short of length outside off, slapped towards extra cover who fumbles it and gives an easy single
length ball, around middle and leg and tickled down the fine leg for a boundary
a tad fuller this time, around middle and leg, and clipped towards square leg
fuller on pads, flicked away towards backward square leg for a single
comes down the track and launches it into the orbit over long-on, a huge hit by Soumya
and again! Almost an action replay of the last ball, skips down again and hits him over long-on, 81 meters, this is finishing soon, folks!
fuller on stumps, driven back towards the bowler
fuller, just outside off, Soumya plays it gently towards short midwicket
clips it towards square leg for a single and keeps the strike
bouncer, down the leg side and Soumya helps it on its way, beats the man at fine leg
back of length, around middle and off, defended on the off side
back of length, angling away, Soumya opens the face to run it down towards short third man for a quick single
short of length down the leg side, a nudge to fine leg
it's raining fours and sixes here, it was a slower one and Soumya skipped down, went through with his shot and got a one-bounce four at midwicket
another bouncer, pulls it away towards deep square leg, moves to 99
length ball, on the pads, plays it towards square leg and gets to his second ODI hundred, off just 81 balls, nine fours and four sixes in that knock
fuller on stumps, pushed back towards the bowler
length ball, goes back and tucks it away towards backward square leg
length ball, Soumya pushes at it, gets a thick outside edge past short third man who chases it tow keep it to two
length ball, comes out of his crease and defends it towards short midwicket
goes for the slog sweep but there is deep square leg in place, one bounce to the fielder
fuller on stumps pushed back towards the bowler
down the track and it's another maximum, reaches the pitch of the ball and lofts it over deep midwicket for his fifth six of the innings
on the pads this time and helped towards short fine leg
short of length outside off, goes back and punches it towards deep backward point
and again! Charges down and takes it on full and launches it over deep midwicket, 92 meters this one, 14 off the over so far
length ball, pushed towards short midwicket
length ball, comes forward and punches it towards deep extra cover
length ball, backs away and hits it towards deep extra cover
length ball, comes forward and defends
fuller outside off, a free-flowing drive towards sweeper cover but only a single
fuller outside off, looks to drive but gets a thick outside edge towards short third man
finally gets one wrong, looks to clear long-on but couldn't get under the ball completely and the long-on takes a good overhead catch tumbling on his back
length ball, on the pads, flicked away towards deep square leg for a couple
fuller on stumps, comes forward and defends
length ball, goes back and works it to the right of short fine leg
fuller outside off, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
length ball, comes forward and defends it towards point
fuller on stumps, driven inside out towards long-off
down the leg side and misses everyone, the short fine leg fielder chases it all the way and pulls it just inside. The batsmen collect three, meanwhile
fuller on stumps, pushed towards short midwicket
and no-ball, pushed on the leg side for a single but once again replays show the bowler had some part of his foot behind the line
short of length, fired in, pulled away towards deep square leg
length ball, angling in, backs away and pushes it towards extra cover
angling in with the arm once more, worked towards backward square leg
fuller around leg stump, pushed towards long-on
pitched up outside off, driven towards sweeper cover
fuller outside off, driven towards extra cover
length ball, just outside off, pushed towards cover-point
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it hard but ends up hitting it straight to the cover fielder
short of length and keeps low, Mushfiqur was playing back but adjusts well to punch it towards extra cover, a bit of chuckle by him after the ball
length ball but down the leg side
floated outside off, steered towards short third man
a low full toss outside off, Mushfiqur works it away towards long-on and keeps the strike
fuller outside off, driven towards long-off
length ball, goes back and flicks it towards deep square leg
length ball, comes forward and defends
length ball, just outside off, sweeps it towards square leg
arm-ball, pitching just outside off, comes forward and dead-bats
another one goes with the arm, comes forward to defend, gets an inside edge on the pads, an appeal for lbw but denied
length ball, around middle and leg, defended
slower bouncer around leg stump, helped away towards fine leg
length ball, around off, defended towards covers
short of length outside off, waits for it before opening the face of the bat to run it towards third man
short of length around rib cage, dabbed towards fine leg to bring up his fourth ODI hundred
fuller and wider and slashed away towards cover boundary for four
shoulders arms as this one skips down leg
full, slid into middle, gets forward and blocks
short, straightening on off, cut to deep point
flicks this from middle and off to deep midwicket
full on off, pushes it to the left of point for one
slides a fuller one across and he gets down on one knee and crunches a big booming slog over deep midwicket
flicks a length ball to short fine
short, spinning away, cut to point
short, a bit of width, stabbed behind point
full on middle and leg, driven to long-off
width on offer, slapped to point
good length on off, defended to point

appeal for lbw, not given by Dharmasena. Zimbabwe contemplate a review and they take it. This might be worth it as it looked close. On a length, straightens past the outside edge and raps the pad. No edge. Clipping top of off, so umpire's call remains
short and wide, cut to sweeper cover
drives a fuller one to long-on
full on middle and leg, driven down to long-on
shifts back and tucks to deep square
punches a length ball to long-off
short and wide, cut to deep point
back of a length, skips down the leg side
tucks a length ball behind square
slants a fuller one across, comes forward and drives past mid-off diving to his right
tucks a length ball to deep square leg
slider, pushed back off the inside of the bat
opens the face to third man
taps a fuller one on the front foot to cover for a quick one
pitched up on middle, flicked to midwicket

ah, Kayes has holed out.. looking for the glorious finish. Wasn't needed but he was set and looking for a big hit or two. Advances down the ground and carts this over mid-off but as he does so the bat turns in his hands and the ball settles into the hands of long-off
dropped. Tries to force a cut with the ball not turning as much, not enough room, gets an outside edge that's shelled by the keeper. Very tough chance
blocks a fuller one off the inside of the bat
backs away and punches through the covers to the right of the sweeper
advances down the ground and blocks to cover
pushes a fuller ball to long-off
length ball on middle and leg, defended
good length on middle, front-foot defense
drops this to point and skips down for a run but is sent back
tucks a length ball to midwicket
loops it up on middle, waits and blocks to point
advances down the ground and tries to heave this slider over the on side, rolls along to deep midwicket off the inside part of the bat
gets forward and blocks a length ball
full toss, driven to extra cover
full toss, angled into him, shovels it straight over mid-on.. one-bounce over the boundary
is that the game? Yes, it is. That has carried for six. Short, straightening around off, Mushfiqur rocks back and pulls over deep midwicket
